title: Interactive Learning Program Based on Animated Videos for Strengthening Digital Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with digital devices and understanding of online communication
context.additional_context: A Project Strengthening Critical Thinking About Digital Environments Through Mathematics-Integrated Activities and Enhancing Civic Consciousness and Resilience via Team-Based Problem Solving

learning_goals: Learners analyze ethical dilemma cases in digital environments via animated videos, with over 80% able to explain correct judgment criteria.
Learners practice three+ strategies for handling cyber conflicts (e.g., cyberbullying) in team activities, with over 90% proposing actionable solutions for real-world scenarios.
Learners connect digital literacy (self-information management, online credibility assessment) with resilience, with over 75% creating actionable daily roadmaps.

resources: Educational animated video series (5 episodes) on cyberbullying
Digital scenario card set (for presenting problem situations)
Wi-Fi infrastructure for BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment setup

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
